book.of.features 1.0.3
  • Reference

    Continuity Creator

    continuity.Rd

    continuity is conceptually based on the 'islands & gaps' concept.

    continuity(
  srcData,
  mapFields,
  timeFields,
  timeout = GAP > timeout,
  boundaryName = "episode",
  archipelago = TRUE,
  show.all = FALSE,
  debug = FALSE
)

    Arguments

    srcData

    (object): The source dataset, including all non-sessioning fields desired

    mapFields

    (string): A comma-separated string literal containing field names that will partition `data`

    timeFields

    (string): A comma-separated string literal containing field names to use as "start" and "stop" temporal indices. If only one value is given, that value will be repeated as the "stop" index

    boundaryName

    (string): The name root of the boundary column names (e.g., "episode" -> "episode_start_idx", "episode_end_idx")

    archipelago

    (logical | TRUE): Should the output include the islands and gaps generated?

    show.all

    (logical | FALSE): Should the output include all of the columns of the output?

    timeout:

    The largest allowable 'gap' in a series of time values before a new 'island' begins: can be a quoted expression that conditionally determines the value.

    Value

    A data.table with columns <mapFields>, ..., timeOut, ISLAND, island_idx, where '...' is empty if `show.all` is FALSE

    See also

    Other Data Generation: bin.windows(), make.date_time(), make.windows()
